job_title: Management in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Competitive salary and benefits. Great training opportunities to build your career in the mental health field.
cons: County contracted agency with much paperwork and many demands.

review_title: We call it Hornetsnest instead of Wellnest. That should tell you enough.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Wellnest tries to be competitive with benefits and salary. You can't spend it if you are burned out, mistreated and have inhuman expectations placed on you that leave you on medical leave.
cons: Absolutely schizophrenic management, led by the CEO herself. Really smooth talker, but staff feel the "say one thing, do another," "one direction this minute, one direction the next" even though she says that "just does not happen at Wellnest. " She is also rude, dismissive, talks down to you, and is the opposite of inclusive of ideas. Of course, even though she "asks" for ideas.

job_title: Program Supervisor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Working at Wellnest provided me a wealth of growth and opportunities through trainings. I love the agency and having a work and life balance is a big plus for me. The only reason I left was to have an opportunity to work with a different population. If I ever need to seek a new job opportunity,Wellnest will be my first choice!
cons: My experience working at Wellnest was great! Loved the values and the work! No Cons for me!

job_title: Clinician 1 Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Flexibility to work from Home or wherever you want
cons: Low pay Work load Documentation

job_title: Administrator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Wellnest is very committed to their vision of providing quality trauma informed mental health and housing services for children from birth to age 25. Their legacy and solid reputation in the community is commendable. I highly recommend employment especially if you're interested in developing your professional skills. They're committed to training and their employees.
cons: Heavy on documentation and processes due to the being governmentally funded. However, they've been serving the community and sustainable for close to 100 years.

job_title: Home Visitor in Los Angeles, CA

review_title: Best Co Workers you'll ever work with

The staff is amazing.

job_title: Clinical Therapist

job_title: Case Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: They match your 401k and good health benefits

job_title: Clinical Therapist II in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Good supervision. EHR convenience. Supportive co-workers and administrative staff. Flexible work schedule. Good health benefits
cons: SDR focused. Passive aggressive management. Poor employee retention. No room for advancement beyond being a therapist. Exhaustive meetings weekly that could’ve been an email. Large caseloads. Limited support for therapists. Rules and guidelines frequently change especially around information about time off. Too much paperwork. Accepts intense clientele into outpatient services to support billing needs and not actual needs of clients. Agency makes major money, pays staff poorly

job_title: Clinical Therapist II in Los Angeles, CA
pros: they offer great health benefits
cons: They are very strick on productivity and and have a high case load

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great mission offering mental health services to an underserved community. Having been around for almost 100 years shows their commitment to the community. Great Senior Management team extremely dedicated to the organizations mission
cons: President/CEO abrasive, aloof and perhaps unaware of what it takes to keep her office running smoothly allowing her to focus on big picture. Never took time to sit down for weekly check in

job_title: Psychologist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: For the new therapist this organization allows familiarization with clients experiencing complex trauma.

job_title: Clinical Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Very supportive management team in my department. I get flexible hours and no micromanaging

Supportive supervisors

review_title: A mission driven organization that cares!
job_title: Administrator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Wellnest is a great place to work and make a difference.
cons: DMH contracted and demanding work.

job_title: Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Working in diverse community. Good experience.
cons: Safety and low pay. High stress job.

review_title: Great job with lots of room for upward mobility and professional development
job_title: Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great opportunities for upward mobility.  I started as an outpatient therapist over 5 years ago and now have an management position that still allows me to have direct contact with our clients.  I love my staff, co-workers and have built life-long friendships.  Management is open to great ideas and suggestions from staff.  I never have a problem speaking directly with upper management.  Lots of great trainings (with free CEUs) that supervisors encourage providers to attend.  I love that new management has encouraged a new focus on community engagement and is very welcoming to those of us who are community activists.  Great medical, dental and vision benefits.  Decent pay, vacation and sick time! LACGC is a great place to make a difference in the lives of children and their families.
cons: I'm saddened by past employees that have somehow been conveyed the message that all management cares about is billing.  While we still need to be mindful that billing is important, (since our paychecks depend on our providers providing excellent service), our main focus is and always will be OUR CLIENTS.  If your not into DMH paperwork, completing your documentation, or providing therapy in someone's home in South LA, then LACGC is not for you.

job_title: Associate Marriage and Family Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Good pay, benefits, time off, and supervision
cons: Hard work, challenging clients, hard work to life balance, paperwork, and keeping up with productivity

job_title: Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Working with the clients
Benefits
Training
Great co workers
cons:
Incompetent management team
Lack of support

job_title: Support Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The Support Department consists of an awesome team who enjoys the opportunity to serve the psychiatrists, clinicians and the Management Team at LACGC, but most of all the clients and their families. LACGC provides ongoing support to ensure staff needs are met and clients are confident in the services we provide. In addition, LACGC is a Legal Entity contracted by the Los Angeles County Department of Mental Health; DMH provides LACGC with ongoing monthly financial trainings to ensure the agency complies with the billing guidelines. DMH provides all Legal Entities Providers with monthly support via Teleconference as a way to ensure agencies are up to date on necessary procedural changes; this ensures LACGC financial needs are met accordingly.
cons: At times, being responsible for ensuring the billing is submitted in a timely manner can be challenging because of some insurance billing methods and CIN changes/updates

review_title: The best non profit agency that I have worked for!
job_title: Home Visitation Program Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: For the last five years, I have managed one of the Clinic's non-clinical programs. As an employee, we have access to free high quality monthly trainings,  free health insurance (for the employee only), generous sick and vacation time accrual, 401K match and life insurance.  The salaries are competitive and if you are bilingual you are eligible for an annual differential.  The staff in the home visitation program that I oversee have formed strong relationships with one another and report being highly satisfied in almost all areas of their employment in the annual staff satisfaction survey.
cons: Since our agency is rapidly growing as it is acquiring new programs and staff, space is an issue. We need more offices for leadership members and storage space. This is an issue that the Executive team is already addressing.

review_title: I found working part of the Intensive Services division to be hostile, inflexible, and draining.
job_title: Clinical Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Competitive salary and clinical supervision hours available for interns working toward their MFT license.
cons: Supervisors are extremely micromanaging and aren't flexible with staff. There is no flexibility in being able to work from home (for salaried staff even) or at a local coffee shop if you're out in the field. You are always expected to begin your day at the office and come back to the office in between clients.

job_title: Clinical Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great coworkers who do amazing work, good benefits, good salary. They used to have a good reputation in the community.
cons: Some of the worst management I have ever seen. They constantly ask for advice and feedback about how to "support" clinicians, and then proceed not to listen to any of it. All that matters at LACGC is productivity and the amount of money you are making for the clinic. Don't make your numbers? They threaten to fire you. Make your numbers? It's because you are burnt out, have worked more hours than you thought possible, and have taken advantage of your clients time. I worked here for a year, and by the end, was debating whether I still wanted to be a therapist. One of the worst experiences of my life. I have never felt so unappreciated and demeaned in a workplace.

job_title: Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: LACGC has made some great strides to best serve the community.  From trainings to expanding services to include housing youth to the development of a new TAY center, this agency is truly committed to providing quality services to the community.  The organization has grown and continues to grow in positive ways.  Benefits were also just revamped and improved so that staff can feel a sincere investment in them.  Lastly, this organization has allowed a number of staff to grow into new opportunities.
cons: Working with the most vulnerable community can truly weigh on staff.  It's hard work.

review_title: I have been with Los Angeles Child Guidance Clinic for 8 years.
job_title: IS Support in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Los Angeles Child Guidance Clinic is a very rewarding employer with the opportunity to be successful in the community as well in the office. Los Angeles Child Guidance Clinic is a great employer that also has great staff and wonderful benefits for employees and their families. Los Angeles Child Guidance Clinic truly cares about their employees and the community.
cons: I have no cons. I believe this agency is great.

job_title: Clinical Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great opportunity to gain BBS hours if you are an intern, paid training and reimbursed for mileage (which you will be traveling alot to schools and homes).
cons: Productivity is the focus like most DMH contracted agencies, but this agency takes it too far. They micromanage you to the max and hound you weekly about how many hours you are spending with clients.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palo Alto, CA
pros: Energetic collegues that really care about serving the community.
cons: Terrible management, staff are not supported clinically but rather pressured to maintain productivity levels for billing. Young and inexperienced coordinators that have no idea how to balance workloads or support staff. Upper management is absolutely horrible and have no idea who you are (nor do they care). No training is offered to staff even though they have a wonderful training institute...its not profitable to send staff. Disguisting and so unethical to put money over clients.

job_title: Outpatient Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Clinical therapists get lots of hours towards licensure, and group & individual supervision. Free trainings in EBPs. Schedule is flexible, nobody makes you account for your time as long as you make your hours.
cons: Management clearly cares more about the amount billed than the quality of services provided. Managers in the outpatient department consistently engage in unprofessional conduct. Higher-ups  are not transparent about decisions made that impact employees and clients.

job_title: Administrative in Los Angeles, CA
pros: LACGC is an organization with an amazing legacy serving vulnerable children and families.  Staff at all levels are dedicated and passionate about the work as demonstrated by their commitment to provide quality services.
cons: DMH funded which has many compliance and regulatory requirements. This can be challenging for staff at all levels.

job_title: Classroom Therapist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: I was part of a team of highly motivated individuals who worked with students who were dual diagnosed in a high school that included as part of its education, behavior modification and daily skill sets.  I was the classroom therapist.
cons: A good program that was eventually closed due to lack of funding.

job_title: Vice President of Programs in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Committed and friendly staff
Mission driven organization dedicated to serving the community
Great opportunity to build partnerships
Great benefits package offered to staff
We just know how to have fun here! (Laughter is a must!)
cons: To work at LACGC requires dedication and sometimes appreciating extended hours.
